titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2608) to provide for an additional temporary extension of programs under the Small Business Act and the Small Business Investment Act of 1958, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-212, by Mr. Woodall.

The resolution makes in order a motion offered by the chair of the Committee on Appropriations that the House concur in the Senate amendment to the bill with the amendment printed in the report. The resolution waives all points of order against consideration of the motion.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 73.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 405.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 237 - 188 (Roll no. 715).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 238 - 185 (Roll no. 716).

bill.summary: 9/20/2011--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2608) to provide for an additional temporary extension of programs under the Small Business Act and the Small Business Investment Act of 1958.
